ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt how to evaluate analysis of primary sources, understand how historiography is both biased yet unbiased, and understand differing viewpoints on a particular historical subject matter.

I learned about the history of interactions between Hindus and Muslims in South Asia, and how there is a lot of crossover between the two religions. I thought this was important knowledge given the fraught political moment in India today.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings were engaging and the class discussion was very helpful.
I thought it was a strong course; there was a good amount of reading but we usually touched upon it in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. This course will provide a broad overview of the tumultuous South Asian region, and can serve as a base for further studies into South Asian history/politics.
Yes, if they were interested in South Asian politics or in religious studies.
